artist: Yamamura Kōka (Toyonari); Publisher: Yamamura Kōka Hanga Kankōkai
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
markings: red artist's seal: 豊成 {Toyonari} | date seal: 大正甲子 {Taishō kinoene} (1924)
medium: Woodblock print, ink and color on paper with mica
portfolio: Untitled set of ten prints from 1924
text: A maiko is an apprentice geisha (or geiko in Kyoto) usually aged 15 to 20 years old. The education takes several years, in which course they also perform songs, dance, and play the shamisen (a three-stringed instrument) for visitors.
title: Maiko
